subject: Re: Parameterized test with default value
msgSnippet: I made a mistake in my previous posting. Unfortunately, until now my post wasn t posted, so I have no source to quote. I have waited a while, but it is very
messageBody:
I made a mistake in my previous posting. Unfortunately, until now my
post wasn't posted, so I have no source to quote. I have waited a
while, but it is very late know so I want go to sleep. Approximate
quote is "We should define helper class because YourTest class must
have only one construtor." It is obviously wrong. You can define
static method (a function) and call it from their. If you want to be
able to overload these functions you can define them as (instance)
methods and in @Parametrized function instantiate YourTest using the
only constructor with "garbage" parameters. Note, that @Parametrized
function is static, so you can't call instance method directly, you
have to instantiate instance of this class. In your subclass you
should just instantiate your subclass instead and mechanism of
inheritance will work.

It is clearly design decision, whether to use helper class or not. You
can avoid this whether by using (static) function or by using
"garbage" as parameters to your constructor. While using a helper
class is much "cleaner" disadvantage of this approach is creation a
helper class.
